page.title: 14ATTITUDES
page.content: {1914-1918-Mrs Douglas 87yrs}remembers TRANENT during and after the first world war.There was much poverty and most men worked in the pits while the women worked in the fields or in service.Where the war memorial now stands was a trough for horses.Life was hard but people were more closely knit.{1939-45-Mrs Luby 85 Mrs Baptie {62 Mrs Muir 76yrs.}Memories of the war were both happy and sad.The war brought people closer together.Food was rationed and when local men were killed the whole town mourned.They all agreed that even though life was tough they had a great life.{1953 Coronation {Elizabeth 11 }-{Mrs.Plain 86yrs } remembers the street parties held then Everybody was singing and dancing and the children were given a coronation mugs and sweets.She watched the ceremony on T.V. for the first time.
